title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Intelligent Management Center dbman Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Hewlett Packard Enterprise Intelligent Management Center. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. 
The specific flaw exists within dbman.exe. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code under the context of SYSTEM.
addtionnal_details: Hewlett Packard Enterprise has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://support.hpe.com/hpsc/doc/public/display?docId=emr_na-hpesbhf03813en_us
timeline:
2017-09-20 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2018-01-25 - Coordinated public release of advisory
2018-01-25 - Advisory Updated
